20140912-d-09-12-14-ALS.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 0330, YAS324 HAD FINISHED COUPLING TRK 038 AND WAS PULLING IT OUT THE  WEST END.  THE EMPLOYEE ON THE GROUND HAD WALKED BACK WESTWARD AND WAS AT THE 037 SWITCH ON THE LEAD AS THE CUTWAS BEING PULLED OUT WHEN HE NOTICED A BOXCAR BOUNCING UP AND DOWN OFF THE RAIL AND SPARKING. HOWEVER IT SNAPPED OFF ABOUT A 15' SECTION OF RAIL IN THE VERY WEST END OF 037.  ALSO THERE IS APPROXIMATELY 1500-1700' OF ROLLED RAIL IN 038. 20140929-d-09-29-14-ALS.Narrative: YAS224 WAS TOLD TO DOUBLE TRACK 034 TO TRACK 057 AND DRAG OUT TO 3 LEAD/4 PER.  CREW MADE THEIR JOINT IN TRACK 057.  HELPER WAS ON THE GROUND AT THE 057 SWITCH CHECKING THE TRAIN LIST AS THE TRAIN WENT BY HIM.  HE TURNED SLIGHTLY TO HIS RIGHT AND SAW SMOKE UP THE LEAD AND HE SAID THE TRAIN DIDN'T LOOK RIGHT.  HE RADIOED TO CREWMEMBER IN CONTROL ON THE ENGINE TO BRING THEM TO A STOP.  HE WALKED UPTHE LEAD TO INVESTIGATE AND DISCOVERED 4 CARS ON THE GROUND.  UPON INVESTIGATION, THE WEST MOST DERAILED CAR HAD COME UNCOUPLED FROM THE CARS BEHIND IT.  THERE WAS CLEAR EVIDENCE THAT THERE HAD BEEN ADRAWBAR BYPASS AT THAT LOCATION.  THE CARS HAD WELDED TOGETHER AND WHEN THEY WERE BEING PULLED OUT,ONCE THEY FOUND THE WEAK SPOT IN THE RAIL, IT CAUSED THE RAIL TO TURNOVER AND CARS TO GO ON THE GROUND.

I092114-d-09-21-14-PATH.Narrative: AT 3:20 PM ON SEPTEMBER 21, 2014, A FIRE BROKE OUT IN A MANHOLE AT 19TH STREET AND 6TH AVENUE IN B TUNNEL.  THIS IS LOCATED IN NEW YORK CITY, BOROUGH OF MANHATTAN. AT THAT TIME, A NORTHBOUND HOBOKEN TO 33RD STREET TRAIN LEFT 14TH STREET STATION ENROUTE TO 33RD STREET.  THE ENGINEER REPORTED TO THE PATH CONTROL CENTER THAT THERE WAS A HEAVY SMOKE CONDITION AND ELECTRICAL ARCING AT THE 19TH STREET LOCATION ADJACENT TO THE TRACK.  THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR WERE INSTRUCTED  BY THE CONTROL CENTER TOCHANGE ENDS AND MOVE THE TRAIN BACK INTO 14TH STREET STATION TO DISCHARGE PASSENGERS.  THE NEW YORKCITY FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS SUMMONED TO THE SCENE AND HIGH VOLTAGE 3RD RAIL ELECTRICAL POWER WAS  REMOVED FROM TRACKS IN TUNNEL A AND TUNNEL B FROM CHRIOSTOPHER STREET TO 33RD STREET STATIONS.  THREE EMPLOYEES SUFFFERED FROM SMOKE INHALATION.  NO PASSENGER INJURIES REPORTED.  AT APPROXIMATELY 6:32 PMTHE FIRE WAS EXTINGUISHED.

I092714-d-09-27-14-PATH.Narrative: ON SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 2014, AT 1:48 AM, A WORK TRAIN WAS BEING MOVED EAST ALONG TRACK 1 INTO HOBOKEN TERMINAL.  THE TRAIN WAS BEING FLAGGED FROM F26 BY CONDUCTOR B. MARTIN, AND ENGINEER B. STRYKER WAS OPERATING FROM WORK MOTOR 882.   F26 AND F24 WERE BEING PUSHED EAST AT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH.  CAR F26 NEGOTIATED SWITCH 7E WITHOUT INCIDENT.  AS THE NO. 2 TRUCK OF F26 NEGOTIATED THE LEFT HAND TURN IN APPROACH TO THE TERMINAL, THE POINT OF DERAILMENT (POD) OCCURRED AT A DISTANCE OF 36 FEET  8INCHES EAST OF SWITCH 7E, AS THE NO. 6 AND 8 WHEELS CLIMBED THE NORTH RAIL AND DERAILED TO THE NORTH.  THE NO. 5 AND 7 WHEELS FELL ONTO THE TIES OF THE TRACK.  THE WHEELS CONTINUED TO ROLL FOR A DISTANCE OF 23 FEET  7 INCHES BEFORE COMING TO A STOP.  BEFORE COMING TO REST, THE NO. 5 AND 7 WHEELS STRUCK THE SIGNAL LX4 TRIPPER BOX LOCATED IN-BETWEEN THE NORTH AND SOUTH RAILS.  THE NO. 2 SIDE OF THENO. 2 END OF F26 STRUCK THE WOODEN PLATFORM EDGE.  THIS DERAILMENT WAS INVESTIGATED AND CONSIDEREDA SLOW SPEED WHEEL CLIMB DERAILMENT OF A FLAT CAR DURING A PUSHING MOVE.

47-d-09-06-14-GRW.Contributing Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
47-d-09-06-14-GRW.Narrative:
ON SEPTEMBER 6, 2014 AT 0034 HOURS THE 2300 STRCL 31 REMOTE CONTROL ASSIGNMENT OPERATING GRW LOCOMOTIVES 320-310 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF PULLING 43S WAREHOUSE WHEN 4 LOADED COIL CARS (GRW 4216, GRW 4237, GRW 4200 AND NSAX 8173) DERAILED AT THE S-YARD LEAD SWITCH. 

THE CREW HAD PREVIOUSLY PULLED 47SAND 49S WAREHOUSES, RESPECTIVELY, AND WAS SHOVING 13 LOADED COIL CARS INTO 43S FROM THE 2S LEAD INORDER TO PULL THAT TRACK. THE FOREMAN, WHO WAS IN CONTROL OF THE MOVEMENT AND POSITIONED ON THE GROUND AT THE 43S WAREHOUSE DOOR, INSTRUCTED HIS HELPER TO POSITION HIMSELF AT THE 43S/45S SWITCH. THE HELPER WAS THEN INSTRUCTED TO LINE THE SWITCH FOR MOVEMENT INTO 43S ONCE THE CONSIST CLEARED THE SWITCH. ONCE THE CONSIST WAS CLEAR AND THE SWITCH WAS THROWN, THE FOREMAN BEGAN SHOVING TOWARDS 43S. WHEN THE MOVEMENT UNEXPECTEDLY STOPPED THE HELPER REALIZED THE 4 SOUTH COIL CARS HAD DERAILED. AS A RESULT OF THE DERAILMENT THE LOADED GRW 7609 (ROUNDTOP) ON 4S WAS DAMAGED WHEN IT CAME IN CONTACT WITHTHE DERAILED NSAX 8173. 

A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE GRW TRANSPORTATION, MAINTENANCE OF WAY, ANDMECHANICAL DEPARTMENTS DETERMINED A FAILURE TO PROVIDE POINT PROTECTION ALLOWED THE S-YARD LEAD SWITCH TO BE RAN, WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY LED TO THE DERAILMENT.
